Noise ModelingÂ¶

class pychell.orbits.rvnoise.ChromaticProcessJ1(data=None, label=None, par_names=None)Â¶

Bases: optimize.noise.GaussianProcess

compute_data_errors(pars, include_corr_error=False, linpred=None)Â¶

Computes the errors added in quadrature for all datasets corresponding to this kernel. :param pars: The parameters to use. :type pars: Parameters

Returns

The data errors.

Return type

np.ndarray

compute_residuals(pars, linpred)Â¶

Computes the final residuals (linpred - noise process)

Parameters

  • pars (Parameters) â The parameters to use.

  • linpred (np.ndarray) â The linear predictor.

Returns

The final residuals.

Return type

np.ndarray

initialize(p0, x1=None, xpred=None, instname1=None, instname2=None)Â¶

Default initializer for correlated noise kernels. By default, only the distance matrix is constructed.

Parameters

  • x1 (np.ndarray, optional) â The x1 vector. Defaults to the Data grid (self.x).

  • xpred (np.ndarray, optional) â The vector to make predictions on. Defaults to x1.

realize(pars, linpred, instname, xpred=None)Â¶

Realize the GP (predict/ssample at arbitrary points). :param pars: The parameters to use. :type pars: Parameters :param residuals: The residuals before the GP is subtracted. :type residuals: np.ndarray :param xpred: The vector to realize the GP on. :type xpred: np.ndarray :param errors: The errorbars, already added in quadrature. :type errors: np.ndarray

Returns

If stddev is False, only the mean GP is returned. If stddev is True, the uncertainty in the GP is computed and returned as well. The mean GP is computed through a linear optimization.

Return type

np.ndarray OR tuple
